programme.title: One Down, Two to Go
programme.desc: Buddies Cal (Fred Williamson), J. (Jim Brown), Chuck (Jim Kelly) and Ralph even the score for a rip-off martial-arts tournament.

programme.title: The Bad Bunch
programme.desc: A Vietnam veteran (Greydon Clark) encounters racial hostility when he attempts to deliver a medal to a dead soldier's family.

programme.title: Super Fly
programme.desc: Before a Harlem cocaine dealer (Ron O'Neal) retires with his girlfriend (Sheila Frazier), he wants to make just one last score.

programme.title: Black Belt Jones
programme.desc: A martial artist (Jim Kelly) helps a father (Scatman Crothers) and daughter (Gloria Hendry) save their school of self-defense from Los Angeles mobsters.

programme.title: The Queen Boxer
programme.desc: An avenger (Judy Lei) of murder destroys a crime ring with her kung fu.

programme.title: The Black Dragon Vs. The Yellow Tiger
programme.desc: In one of the earliest and least-seen Bruceploitation epics, Tong Lung (THE FEROCIOUS BROTHERS) assumes the mannerisms to star in this very unofficial sequel to Bruce Lee's THE WAY OF THE DRAGON.

programme.title: Bruce's Deadly Fingers
programme.desc: Malicious gangsters capture Bruce's former girlfriend, then a young martial artist attempts to rescue her and the late master's book containing lethal techniques for killing with a finger.

programme.title: Blackstar Warrior
programme.desc: In a 1970s version of the future, a space detective searching for the truth about his real mother uncovers his adoptive parents' secret genetics lab and discovers it's controlled by a space nun cult bent on taking over the galaxy.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Stokely Carmichael, the revolutionary leader who created and promulgated the now historic cry of Black Power, talks of his current plans that will bring Blacks together.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.sub-title: If You Don't Know Me By Now
programme.desc: Guests include popular singing group Harold Melvin and the Blue Notes, singer Esther Marrow, and Ida Lewis, editor of Encore magazine.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Soul! staff, Ellis Haizlip, Al Brown, Anna Horsford, Sherri Santifer, Loretta Greene and Leslie Demus read poetry and letters from viewers throughout the country.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Former heavyweight boxing champion Muhammad Ali is interviewed.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Mrs. Georgia Jackson, mother of slain Soledad Brother George Jackson, is interviewed by producer Ellis Haizlip; Latin-jazz sounds of seven man combo, Mandrill; LaBelle (Formerly Patti LaBelle and the Bluebells).

programme.title: Rock and Roll Revue
programme.desc: Vintage clips of great jazz artists.

programme.title: Adios Amigo
programme.desc: A frontier con man (Richard Pryor) tries scams that never work, leaving his partner (Fred Williamson) behind to explain.

programme.title: Joshua
programme.desc: Men who return home from the Civil War with hopes of rebuilding their lives find death and destruction.

programme.title: Mean Johnny Barrows
programme.desc: A Vietnam veteran (Fred Williamson) gets caught in a mob war with a couple of double-crossers (Jenny Sherman, Roddy McDowall).

programme.title: Mr. Ricco
programme.desc: A San Francisco lawyer (Dean Martin) helps his client (Thalmus Rasulala) beat a murder rap marked by racial overtones.

programme.title: Under Siege
programme.desc: Two military madmen (Tommy Lee Jones, Gary Busey) hijack a nuclear-armed Navy battleship with a SEAL commando (Steven Seagal) on board as a cook.
